quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Group and Album
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, vocalist, jam. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Belinda Carlisle used to do lead vocals for this 80s punk girl group.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Go Gos

questions.question: This RB and dance music singer recorded her first album at the age of 12. The album, produced and arranged by  Van McCoy featured the disco tune When Youre Young and in Love.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Stacy Lattisaw

questions.question: Although Limahl  was later fired after a disagreement, this group went to number 1 on the UK charts with his help.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kajagoogoo

questions.question: Peter Wolf played with this popular rock and roll band in the 70s, that moved toward a more pop-influenced style in the 80s.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: J. Geils Band

questions.question: This African American soul singer released the 1985 album Rock Me Tonight, which contains two Top 20 songs, You Are My Lady and Rock Me Tonight ( for Old Times Sake).
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Freddie Jackson

questions.question: Jody Watley was a part of this disco-driven group, founded in the late 70s.

options.text: K. C and The Sunshine Band

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Shalamar

questions.question: Morrissey was a member of this British rock group from 1982 to 1987, before leaving to focus on his solo career.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Smiths

questions.question: Which of these bands was Steve Winwood not a member of?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cream

questions.question: This British pop-reggae band recorded the hit Pass the Dutchie, one of the best-selling singles of 1982.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Musical Youth

questions.question: This Guyana-born musician released the song Electric Avenue which, in 1983, became both U.S. and UK number 2?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eddy Grant

questions.question: Name the performer of this 80s hit song.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kim Wilde

questions.question: Steve Perry made his public debut as singer for this band in October 1977.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Journey

questions.question: In 1987 this rock-jazz-pop band released their debut album entitled Its Better To Travel , which included the single Breakout.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Swing Out Sister

questions.question: Don Henley was a vocalist, drummer, and guitarist with this group.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Eagles

questions.question: Jimmy Jam and Terry Lewis were members of The Time.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: The Mothers of Invention were a rock and roll band active from the 1960s to the 1990s, that originally consisted of drummer Jimmy Carl Black, bassist Roy Estrada, saxophonist Davy Coronado, guitarist Ray Hunt, and singer Ray Collins.  After Ray Hunt left the group in 1964, what  famous American composer, guitarist, singer and satirist took his spot?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Frank Zappa
